newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-ROBBINS SHATTERS RECORD IN WINNING TOURNAMENT BY EIGHT.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-ROBBINS SHATTERS RECORD IN WINNING TOURNAMENT BY EIGHT.

text.p: Kelly Robbins shattered the tournament record Sunday in winning the $700,000 LPGA Jamie Farr Classic at the Highland Meadows golf Club by eight strokes.
Robbins, 27, shot her second successive four-under-par 67 for a 72-hole total of 19-under 265, eclipsing the mark of 15-under set by Brandie Burton in 1993 when this was a 54-hole event.
Tammie Green was a distant second at 11-under 273. Hall of Famer Nancy Lopez was nine strokes back at 274, followed by Vickie Odegard at 276 and Terry-Jo Myers and Karrie Webb of Australia at 277.
"That's pretty good golf," Robbins said after taking her second tournament title of the season.
"I want to go into the (U.S. Women's) Open on a good note," she said with a look ahead to next week's major championship in Cornelius, Oregon. "It's good to see things come around."
Two-time defending U.S. Open champion Annika Sorenstam of Sweden took this week off.
Robbins's eight-stroke victory margin is the largest on the LPGA Tour since Liselotte Neumann won the 1996 Tournament of Champions by 11 shots.

Robbins, who also won the National Pro-Am in February, strung together four rounds of 67 or better, including a record-tying 64 Friday, to capture the $105,000 first prize. She remained third on the LPGA money list with $527,581.
